summary:
I specialize in making events memorable as a keynote speaker, moderator, guest panelist, workshop facilitator, or event MC by helping my clients self-actualize their individual greatness to move beyond internal or external barriers.  Essentially, I use my voice to help others find theirs.  

“Fabulous, knowledgeable, compassionate, and dynamic,” “I have received multiple requests to have Jennifer return!!” “Outstanding master of her craft!” “Engaging and enlightening, her charismatic charm and witty sense of humor continually wins over the audience’s hearts” These are a few testimonials from my audiences.  I have been requested to speak at small intimate retreat settings to packed hotel convention centers and arenas.  My clients include students at Howard University, First Baptist Church of Glenarden, commencement speaker for William Penn High School Graduating Class of 2018, just to name a few. 

 I am a USN retired combat veteran, Distinguished Toastmaster, a multidimensional inspirational influencer, published author, as well as domestic violence advocate.  After serving our country proudly for 21.7 years, I pursued a second career as an entrepreneur and in 2013 started my first business, Inspirationally Speaking, LLC where I inspire, motivate, and empower thousands of people around the country to walk boldly in their purpose.  My passion and knowledge of leadership, work-life balance, team building, and diversity in corporate America has motivated and transcended the internal and external business practices of several local, state, and federal government agencies as a corporate trainer through my seminars.  I also aim to encourage individuals to Get F.I.T( Focused Intentional & Thriving) so they can find their personal peace, purpose and power.  It's through my various platforms to include my self-published book titled Tomorrow My Sunshine Will Come: Memoirs of Women Who Survived Domestic Violence as well as my prolific blog G.U.M.B.O. (Greatness Unbounded Moving Beyond Ordinary) that men and women are empowered. I am also the Founder and CEO of Unstoppable You Ministries, Inc. which is a nonprofit 501c3 organization that provides supportive resources to people affected by domestic violence, human trafficking, and homelessness. 

Contact Me:
Inspirationally Speaking, LLC, - jennifer@inspirationallyspeaking.com - 1 (410) 449-2173
Unstoppable You Ministries, Inc. - jennifer@unstoppableyouministriesinc.org - 1 (833) 330-7867
fullName: Jennifer C. Foxworthy, LMSW, VASII, MSM, DTM

currentPositions.description:
Jennifer C. Foxworthy was born and raised in York, Pennsylvania.  Once she graduated high school from William Penn Senior High in 1991, she embarked on a journey that would lead her into an illustrious career serving in the United States Navy.  Jennifer served her country proudly for 21 years (September 23, 1991 to April 30, 2013) retiring as a Chief Petty Officer (E-7).  

Jennifer is pursuing her second career as the Founder and CEO of Inspirationally Speaking, LLC, and the Founder and CEO of Unstoppable You Ministries, Inc.  Jennifer continues to be of service to others through her purpose and passion as an award winning motivational speaker, international published author of “Tomorrow My Sunshine Will Come: Memoirs of Women Who Survived Domestic Violence,” television show host of Living Unshackled ON Purpose, host of Unstoppable You Conference, corporate trainer, as well as prolific blogger of “G.U.M.B.O.”  

As an inspirational influencer, Jennifer travels the country as a powerful motivational speaker to help women find their personal peace, purpose, and power by transparently using her life experiences on topics of self-esteem, domestic violence awareness, overcoming adversity, self-care, and much more.  Jennifer states, “Essentially, I use my voice to help others find theirs.”
currentPositions.title: Founder and CEO

We love visitors!  I encourage anyone who wants to improve their public speaking skills to stop by and join us.  If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact me at jennifer@inspirationallyspeaking.com.

publications.description: My book shares the journeys of six women, to include mine, who through unfortunate circumstances found themselves trapped in the nightmare of an abusive relationship.  I wrote this book to inspire and provide insight about this horrible epidemic.
publications.name: Tomorrow My Sunshine Will Come: Memoirs of Women Who Survived Domestic Violence

publications.description: I wrote this article in the May issue of Southern Maryland Woman Magazine to create awareness concerning the horrible epidemic of domestic violence and that even I, a retired combat military veteran, found myself in this personal nightmare.
publications.name: Domestic Violence Knows No Boundaries

message.text:
📷 I took these pictures at the National Harbor in Maryland. 

🤔 In the midst of serene waters and quiet docks, this powerful sculpture captures a struggle beneath the surface—a poignant reminder of the unseen battles many face. Just as this figure reaches out for help, survivors of domestic violence often endure their pain in silence, yearning for a lifeline. Let's extend our hands and hearts to support those fighting to break free from the chains of abuse. Together, we can bring them back to solid ground. 💜

#BreakTheSilence #EndDomesticViolence #ReachOut

It's ok to take a break. Take the time to recharge and reset. Whether it's a short walk outdoors, a few minutes of deep breathing, or indulging in your favorite hobby, make time for activities that bring you joy and relaxation. Remember, self-care isn't selfish—it's essential for maintaining your mental and emotional resilience!

Share your favorite self-care activities in the comments below and let's inspire each other to make self-care a non-negotiable part of our daily routines. 
 #SelfCare #MentalHealthMatters

#wellness #mentalhealthawarenessmonth 

❤What are you depositing into your self-care bank today?

🌊For the next few days I will be poured into at the National Association of Social Workers Maryland Chapter conference in Ocean City.  I didn't specifically ask for a room with a balcony and view of the ocean, but God knew. I am drawn to water. It makes my heart smile. 

❓What makes your heart smile?

🤗Today, make a point to intentionally deposit into your wellness bank: Intellectually, Financially, Emotionally, Socially, Environmentally, Spiritually, and Physically.  

*Side note- I already got the physical wellness in when the hotel had an emergency alarm go off at 3:40am this morning. I walked down nine flights of steps only to arrive outside to be told it was a false alarm 😯. Needless to say the elevators were full and busy, so I walked back up nine flights of stairs😴 

#unstoppableyou #selfcare #wellnessjourney #siezetheday #GoodMorningEveryone

It IS a big deal! 

Did you know that approximately 1 in 5 adults in the United States experiences mental illness each year? That's a staggering statistic, reminding us of the importance of mental health awareness and support.

💡 It's crucial to break the stigma surrounding mental health and encourage open conversations about it. Let's create a culture where seeking help for mental health challenges is normalized and where everyone feels supported and understood.

🤝Together, we can make a difference by advocating for mental health resources, fostering empathy and understanding, and promoting self-care practices that prioritize mental well-being. Remember, you are not alone, and help is always available. Let's continue spreading awareness and support for mental health every day.

#MentalHealthAwareness #BreakTheStigma #YouAreNotAlone #EndTheSilence

Commitment
1. The state or quality of being dedicated to a cause, activity, etc.
2. An engagement or obligation that restricts freedom of action.

If you are being challenged in your personal and professional life with public speaking and/or leadership, then it's time to determine how bad do you want to get to the next level.  It won't happen sitting in your comfort zone.  It will take a level of commitment.  That's when we have to make the decision to dig in and get focused on our goals in order to succeed.  

Consider checking out our Toastmasters International club Talk of the Town Toastmasters - Maryland (9410) on the 2nd and 4th Mondays of every month (except holidays) from 12 to 1pm EST in a hybrid format.  Our club is open and anyone can visit.  We are looking for new members who are committed to improving their communication and leadership skills.  Let us help you!

#communicationskills #leadershipskills #confidence #commitment #toastmastersinternational #whereleadersaremade

📚 Happy World Book Day! 📚

On this special day dedicated to the joy of reading, we're thrilled to celebrate the transformative power of literature with "Tomorrow My Sunshine Will Come" by Jennifer Foxworthy. 🌟

This remarkable book isn't just a story—it's a beacon of hope, courage, and resilience. Through the heartfelt narratives of survivors who found their sunshine after escaping domestic violence, it shines a light on the strength of the human spirit.

Join us in honoring World Book Day by diving into the pages of "Tomorrow My Sunshine Will Come." Let its empowering stories inspire you, uplift you, and remind you of the incredible strength within us all. 🌻

https://lnkd.in/eh7w8Xw

What book are you celebrating World Book Day with? Share your literary adventures in the comments below! 📖

#WorldBookDay #TomorrowMySunshineWillCome #EmpowerSurvivors

Friday is the perfect day to show appreciation for your colleagues and team members. Take a moment to say thank you for their hard work this week. 

#teamwork #appreciation #thankyou

Psalms 4:7 "You have put more joy in my heart than they have when their grain and wine abound." (ESV)

🤩As we enter a new week, let's seize each moment as a new opportunity to be focused, intentional, and thriving.  Being F.I.T. is not just my brand and slogan, but behaviors I truly try to live by.  Sometimes I am knocking it out the park, and others I need to take a step back and regroup.  No matter what, keep moving forward.  Remember YOUR WHY!  

🫶🫵Don't forget to deposit into your self-care cup.  

🙏Please know I am praying for you to have an unspeakable joy in your heart as you face the week.  I am cheering you on! 🥳

#UnspeakableJoy #joyinyourheart #focused #intentional #thriving #selfcare #fillyourcupfirst

Let's create tsunamis of greatness and move mountains!

Have an Unstoppable weekend on purpose!

#unstoppable #GreaterTogether #uyminc
Sarah Bedsaul, PHR thank you for this helpful and insightful information that all managers can use.

Book some time to talk! Let's come up with some #solutions together!
https://lnkd.in/esUdECBs

"Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much." - Helen Keller

This quote beautifully captures the essence of collaboration and highlights how working together can achieve far greater results than individual efforts alone. Collaboration harnesses diverse perspectives, skills, and strengths to tackle challenges and accomplish shared goals effectively.

#Collaboration #Teamwork #Unity #TogetherWeAreStronger

Did You Know⁉️

😞Every 68 seconds, another American is sexually assaulted. 
😞98% of rapists will never spend a day in jail. 
🫵🙏To learn more and help bring rapists to justice with RAINN at rainn.org.

🩵April is Sexual Assault Awareness and Prevention Month.  The ribbon color is teal.  Let's come together and educate ourselves about the sexual violence that millions around the world experience.  Unstoppable You Ministries, Inc. is in the trenches and you can find other helpful resources at https://lnkd.in/ekHJ6tJA

#SexualAssaultAwarenessMonth #preventioniskey #SpeakUp #speakupforthevoiceless

Embrace a Growth Mindset: View setbacks as opportunities for growth and learning rather than failures. Encourage team members to adopt a mindset that welcomes challenges as a chance to develop new skills and insights.
This approach not only helps you navigate obstacles more effectively but also fosters a culture of continuous improvement and resilience within your team.
#CareerTip #GrowthMindset #OvercomingChallenges #ContinuousLearning #Resilience

In life, we're bound to face challenges that test our strength and resolve. But it's how we respond to adversity that truly defines us. Resilience isn't about avoiding obstacles; it's about confronting them with courage and determination.

Every setback is an opportunity for growth. It's a chance to learn, adapt, and emerge even stronger than before. So let's embrace resilience in the face of adversity, knowing that we have the power to overcome any obstacle that comes our way.

Remember, you are stronger than you think, and you have the resilience within you to conquer anything life throws your way. Keep pushing forward, and never lose sight of your ability to rise above challenges and thrive.

#Resilience #OvercomingAdversity #Strength #Courage #Determination #KeepGoing

🔦April is Sexual Assault Awareness Month.  Let's shine the light on this horrible nightmare that so many unfortunately experience.  It's important to be mindful of all forms of sexual violence.  The trauma can impact the person mentally, emotionally, and physically.  Throughout this month we will be sharing important facts and resources to help educate and empower the masses.

🎤🗣I am excited to come alongside the St. Mary's College of Maryland Wellness Center and the The Southern Maryland Center for Family Advocacy as they host the national campaign "Take Back the Night" event.  I am honored be one of the special guest speakers.  

👉I invite everyone to come out and support this free to the public event on Thursday, April 18th at the Cole Cinema and the Campus Patio from 6:30pm to 8pm.

#takebackthenight #SexualAssaultAwarenessMonth #collaborationovercompetition #sexualviolenceawareness

🤗💪March is Social Work Month and I wanted to offer some encouragement to all the social workers out there trying to make a difference.  Being a social worker can be a thankless job. But remember your WHY. Let the message on the back of my shirt motivate you to keep going "Social Work: We're not in it for the income, we're in it for the outcome." 

❤ I am so glad I joined the human services profession and earned my Master's in Social Work through Salisbury University. As an advocate to bring awareness to domestic violence, human trafficking, and homelessness, my education and lived experience allows me to show compassion, get into the trenches, and come alongside our clients.  It's the moments when a person gets the services they need so they can stand on their own, that makes it all worth it.

#rememberyourwhy #socialworkmonth #advocacy #makeadifference

The PA Department of Human Services, Office of Mental Health and Substance Abuse Services, Bureau of Children's Behavioral Health Services, and the PA Care Partnership, will be hosting the 21st Children's Interagency Conference from April 22 - 25, 2024 at the State College, PA.  I am absolutely honored to be one of breakout session presenters.  I will be providing training on Domestic Violence and Human Trafficking: The Psychological Impact on Children.

About the conference:
The 21st Children's Interagency Conference brings together Pennsylvania's Child and Adolescent Service System Program (CASSP) and System of Care (SOC) partners providing behavioral health.  The conference will provide an excellent opportunity for providers, county administrators, youth, family members, practitioners, and educators to learn about changing trends, promising and best practices, resources and various system of care activities across Pennsylvania.  The conference also will add a national perspective on a variety of issues including government, family peer, early childhood, youth leadership, and school-based mental health.  

Register: https://lnkd.in/ea9z7RAG

#childtrauma #conference #workshoppresenter #domesticviolenceawareness #psychologicalimpact #humantraffickingawareness

The mark of a truly exceptional leader isn't just in their strategic prowess or decision-making skills; it's in their ability to understand and empathize with the emotions of those they lead. By tuning into the feelings of others, great leaders inspire their team members to reach new heights and unlock their full potential.

Emotional intelligence isn't just a soft skill—it's a cornerstone of effective leadership. When leaders cultivate empathy, they create a culture of trust, collaboration, and innovation. Today, let's celebrate the power of emotional intelligence in driving personal and professional growth! 

 #EmotionalIntelligence #Leadership #TeamEmpowerment #Inspiration #PersonalGrowth

Enjoying the Ark Encounter.
Have faith and keep moving forward!

#GodsPlan #FollowTheBluePrint

Emotional intelligence (EQ) plays a pivotal role in both personal and professional success. It's the ability to identify and regulate our own emotions while understanding the emotions of others. With a high EQ, we can build stronger relationships, reduce stress, defuse conflicts, and enhance job satisfaction.

Let's prioritize developing our emotional intelligence to create a more positive and productive work environment! 💼

 #EmotionalIntelligence #ProfessionalDevelopment #WorkplaceSuccess #Teamwork
